intro: Phyllanthus ankazobensis, commonly known as the Madagascar spurge, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and thick, fleshy leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the rainforest canopy. Its leaves are often covered in a waxy cuticle, which helps reduce water loss in its humid habitat. Phyllanthus ankazobensis is also notable for its medicinal properties, used traditionally in local remedies.
